org.webcurator.core.archive.dps
Class FixityUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.webcurator.core.archive.dps.FixityUtils

public final class FixityUtils
extends java.lang.Object

FixityUtils is a static utility class that provides MD5 calculation methods for Files, and input streams.

Author:
rossb

Method Summary

          Returns the MD5 value of the physical file represented by the File object

Method Detail

calculateMD5

public static java.lang.String calculateMD5(java.io.File theFile)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Returns the MD5 value of the physical file represented by the File object

Parameters:
theFile - - The File object associated with the physical file to have its MD5 calculated.
Returns:
A String representing the MD5 value of the File.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an internal error occurs in the MD5 calculation.

calculateMD5

public static java.lang.String calculateMD5(java.io.File theFile,
                                            org.webcurator.core.archive.dps.FixityUtils.BufferSize bufferSize)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Returns the MD5 value of the physical file represented by the File object, using a read buffer of the size specified.

Parameters:
theFile - the File object associated with the physical file to have its MD5 calculated.
bufferSize - a BufferSize enum object identifying the size of the read buffer to be used. e.g. FixityUtils.BufferSize.MEDIUM
Returns:
A String representing the MD5 value of the File.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an internal error occurs in the MD5 calculation.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.

calculateMD5

public static java.lang.String calculateMD5(java.lang.String filePath)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            java.io.FileNotFoundException
Returns the MD5 value of the physical file identified in the String object.

Parameters:
filePath - a String identifying the file (with prefix path if required) to have its MD5 calculated.
Returns:
A String representing the MD5 value of the File.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filePathString is null.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an internal error occurs in the MD5 calculation.

                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

Returns the MD5 value of the physical file identified in the String object, using a read buffer of the size specified.

Parameters:
filePath - a String identifying the file (with prefix path if required) to have its MD5 calculated.
bufferSize - a BufferSize enum object identifying the size of the read buffer to be used. e.g. FixityUtils.BufferSize.MEDIUM
Returns:
A String representing the MD5 value of the File.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filePathString is null.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an internal error occurs in the MD5 calculation.
